Authors:
Lynn Delgat, Terry Henkel, Tim Claerhout, Annemieke
Verbeken
Title:
Lactifluus pruinolamellatus (Russulaceae, Basidiomycota), a
new species from monodominant Dicymbe corymbosa forest
Abstract:
The tropical forests of the Guiana shield are dominated by
trees of the Fabaceae family, such as Dicymbe. These forests represent a
unique habitat for ectomycorrhizal fungi, with one of the most species
rich families in these habitats being the Russulaceae. A new species of
Lactifluus was discovered from monodominant Dicymbe corymbosa forest in
the Upper Potaro River Basin in the Pakaraima Mountains in Guyana, and
is described here: Lactifluus pruinolamellatus.
